intro: Hedyosmum grisebachii, commonly known as the black hedyosmum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing habit and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Hedyosmum grisebachii is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
